The old tax regime refers to the tax system that was in place in India prior to the implementation of the new tax regime in the financial year 2020-2021. Under the old tax regime, individuals had the option to pay tax at the applicable tax rates or claim deductions and exemptions to reduce their tax liability.

The new tax regime, on the other hand, does not offer deductions and exemptions, but instead provides a lower tax rate for individuals who forego these deductions and exemptions. The new tax regime also introduces a higher tax rate for individuals with a higher income.

As a resident individual in India, you have the option to choose between the old tax regime and the new tax regime each financial year. You can choose the tax regime that provides the lower tax liability based on your individual circumstances. It is a good idea to consult with a tax professional to determine which tax regime is more beneficial for you.
